response.original_title: Artists of the 20th Century: Paul Klee
response.overview: Paul Klee, a Swiss-German artist, was a highly influential figure in 20th-century art, known for his unique and diverse style that blended elements of Expressionism, Cubism, and Surrealism. He was a member of Der Blaue Reiter movement and later taught at the Bauhaus school, contributing significantly to the development of modern art. Klee's work is characterized by its exploration of color theory, his inventive use of various techniques, and his ability to create fantastical and childlike yet deeply meditative works.
response.title: Artists of the 20th Century: Paul Klee
